#Text=Get Along With Roommates in Your Apartment
#Text=Living with strangers , or even friends , can be challenging – especially if it ’s your first time living away from home .
#Text=While you can introduce a ‘ family ’ atmosphere to an apartment full of strangers , it ’s important to realize that new boundaries apply .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Respect each other 's property .
#Text=This may sound basic , but there are certain liberties people can take with their own family that they ca n’t with others .
#Text=While your mother had an open pantry and your siblings did n’t mind sharing their clothes , this may not fly in an apartment arrangement .
#Text=Some people are guarded of their possessions , and rightly so .
#Text=Establish the boundaries early – is it acceptable to borrow clothes , browse through each other ’s music collection , use somebody else ’s personal computer , etc.
#Text=Decide whether to share food or cook separately .
#Text=Communal meals or dinner for one ?
#Text=There are advantages to both strategies .
#Text=Sharing food can help you save money because you split the price of dietary staples .
#Text=However , if you are n’t a large eater you may find yourself spending above your weight .
#Text=Also , settling on a diet that everyone agrees upon can be difficult .
#Text=Cooking for yourself can be more convenient because you only have to please yourself .

#Text=If your roommates have boyfriends or girlfriends who often hang around the apartment , buying your own groceries wo n’t make you worry that you ’re supporting the food plan of a ‘ significant other ’ .
#Text=Also , you can eat on your own time schedule and purchase whatever food you want regardless of others ’ budgets .
#Text=That ’s not to say you ca n’t share certain foods though .
#Text=Often apartment roommates share food staples such as milk , sugar and bread .
#Text=If you run out of something , it ’s nice to have an understanding with your roommates that you ’re allowed to borrow something of theirs until you replenish your stock .
#Text=If you all cook separately , and at different times , you might consider arranging a weekly sit-down meal together .
#Text=Dining together is one of the easiest and most satisfying ways to bring people closer .
#Text=Clean up after yourself .
#Text=If you make a mess do n't leave it for someone else to look after .
#Text=Take your turn to tidy , sweep , and mop the common areas .
#Text=If you share a place , you all have equal responsibility to keep it clean .
#Text=Make sure you do your fair share of household chores , such as taking out the trash and recycling , cleaning the washroom , and emptying the fridge of rotting food .
#Text=Video
#Text=Tips
#Text=Take care in choosing your roommates .
#Text=Living with friends can either be a very rewarding experience or a very trying experience , depending on your relationship history .
#Text=Some of the benefits of living with friends include knowing whether or not they 're reliable .
#Text=You have an idea of their financial history and whether you can trust them to pay the apartment rent on time .
#Text=With friends , you ’re more likely to have common interests and even common friends , which can make your apartment more welcoming for visitors .
#Text=However , knowing each other well brings higher expectations , which can sometimes lead to disappointment .
#Text=Often it is better to share an apartment with acquaintances - people you know enough to trust – rather than close friends .
#Text=Seeing each other every day might grate on each other ’s nerves and a once strong friendship might quickly sour .
#Text=You might also find your friendship suffers because you stop spending time together outside of the apartment .
#Text=Trust your instincts when it comes to living with strangers .

#Text=This type of living arrangement is a good way to expand your social network , and it also grants you more independence to do your own thing – strangers are less likely to worry about your comings and goings .
#Text=But if their social skills or integrity are questionable , choose another apartment or another roommate . Ask for personal references before making a final decision on a potential roommate .
